question: This resection of a skull lesion shows a <image 1>
options: ['Eosinophilic granuloma', 'osteosarcoma', 'trauma with repair', 'malignant germ cell tumor']
description: The image depicts a histological section of tissue stained with hematoxylin and eosin (H&E). The tissue appears to have a dense, fibrous structure with areas of pink staining, indicating the presence of collagen fibers. There are also regions with a more blue-purple hue, suggesting the presence of cellular components or nuclei. The overall appearance suggests a reparative process rather than a neoplastic one. The tissue does not show the characteristic features of malignancy, such as atypical cells or abnormal mitotic figures. Instead, it resembles a healing response, possibly due to trauma.
